Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Randy J Romanowski was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Court grants 112 days credit for time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.
Maintain/obtain full time employment and or schooling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Not to enter on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol.(bars, taverns, etc) besides a grocery store.
No contact with Daniel R. or Carla K.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided and pay surcharge.
Not to operate a MV unless properly licensed.
Count 7 was dismissed outright.
DNA surcharge and Blood draw fees to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. Blood fees will be forwarded to the City of Muskego.

Fine to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Restitution in the amount of $640.36 to be paid as follows: $500.00 to Carla K. and $140.36 to American Family.

AS OF 6/17/2015: Court amends restitution of $640.36 to be directed to Karla K.

supervisions.notes: Attend Victim Impact Panel Meeting while out on Extended Supervision.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Randy J Romanowski in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Colloquy.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 7 is dismissed by operation of law.  Counts 2-6 are dismissed and read in.

The Court Orders the Following:

6 years Imprisonment (Credit - 112 days)
- 3 years of Initial Confinement
- 3 years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
- No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
- No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
- Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed;
- Inform agent of all prescriptions;
- Operate a Motor Vehicle with a Valid Drivers License;
-Maintain/Obtain full time employment and or schooling;
-  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.
- No contact with Daniel R and Carla K..
- Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge


RESTITUTION:  $640.36 ($500.00 to Carla K and $140.36 to American Family)

FINE:  $2658.00  
DNA Surcharge: $250.00
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to  Muskego  Police Department.

DL REVOCATION:  36 months.

IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel 

Other:  AODA Assessment and follow through

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Felony warnings, immigration warnings,  voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 3, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Randy J Romanowski in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests that this matter be put over for plea/sentencing next week. Speedy trial demand waived by Defense. Court has colloquy with the defendant of his giving up his right to a jury trial. Court will set the matter over to next week. Jury trial is canceled for June 2, 2015.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
